references.paper_title: Equilibrium efficiency improvement in MIMO interference systems: A decentralized stream control approach
references.reason: This paper provides a foundation for the concept of potential games and their application in decentralized settings, which is directly relevant to multi-team games discussed in the main paper.
This paper provides crucial mathematical tools for analyzing non-stationary stochastic processes, essential for handling the dynamics of evolving opponent strategies in multi-team games.

references.paper_title: The statistical mechanics of strategic interaction
references.reason: This paper introduces log-linear learning dynamics which serves as a foundation for Team-FP, the core algorithm of the paper.

references.paper_title: Zero-sum polymatrix games: A generalization of minmax
references.reason: This paper extends the concept of zero-sum games to polymatrix games with multiple agents, closely related to ZSPTGs studied in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Computational results for extensive-form adversarial team games
references.reason: This paper focuses on efficient computation of team-minimax equilibrium, providing a comparative approach to the team-learning strategy proposed in the main paper.
